title: Ticket #3823: Use stale info in passwd_cache for a short period
description:
When an entry in the passwd_cache becomes stale, the next query about that user account results in consulting the OS, in case the information has changed. If the OS call fails, then the passwd_cache also returns failure.

We have seen a server at CERN where for a minute every day, queries to the OS about user accounts return "no such account", due we believe to maintenance on the local ldap server. If a Condor daemon looked up any user account during this time and the passwd_cache entry was stale, the daemon got a failure. This could lead to a job failing to run or the daemon exiting.

When a call to the OS about a user account fails and we have stale information in the passwd_cache, we could use that stale information for a short period of time. That would make Condor more resilient to short-lived ldap server failures.
